newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: MANILA COMMENDS FOOTBALLER FOR SPURNING BRIBE.
newsitem.headline: MANILA COMMENDS FOOTBALLER FOR SPURNING BRIBE.

text.p: President Fidel Ramos has commended a Filipino footballer for spurning a $50,000 bribe offer by gamblers in Singapore to throw a game against Malaysia in the Tiger Cup tournament, the presidential palace said on Sunday.

Army sergeant July Saluria, who played for the Philippine team in the September tournament in Singapore, helped Singapore police arrest a Singaporean and two Malaysian members of the gambling ring by "acting as a bait," it said.

The palace said in a statement that Saluria, a defender, had been offered the amount in exchange for the Philippines losing the game by seven goals which would have enabled Malaysia to enter the semi-final round.
The statement gave no details of the entrapment operation.
"Unmindful of your personal safety, you even allowed yourself to act as a bait in the...operation," Ramos said in a letter to Saluria.
"As your commander in chief, I am every proud of you for upholding the dignity and integrity of a true Filipino, who does not compromise honour for wealth," Ramos said.
